intro: Lactuca sativa, commonly known as lettuce, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its crisp, edible leaves that vary in texture and color, ranging from green to red and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has a rosette-shaped growth pattern. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming in a composite head, which is typical of the daisy family. Lactuca sativa is cultivated worldwide for its leaves, which are used in various culinary dishes.
